 Inköpsorganisationen är ett område som ansvarar för bankens globala inköpsprocess. Enheten består av 18 medarbetare som arbetar med inköp/upphandling, förhandling, leverantörsuppföljning och konsultinköp. Vi är på en resa att gå från en reaktiv och regelverksstyrd upphandlingsenhet till en proaktiv inköpsorganisation. Vi har ett tätt samarbete med olika funktionsområden i banken, vilka har olika kontrollpunkter i inköpsprocessen.
   

  

**Din roll**
 I din roll som inköpare kommer du att:
   

  

* Stötta avtalsägare och koordinera aktiviteter i inköpsprocessen som behövs för att fatta inköpsbeslut, vilka genererar högsta kvalitet, tillförlitlighet och värde.
* Ansvara för att, i samarbete med avtalsägare, driva upphandlingar genom hela processen.
* Säkerställa uppfyllnad av inköpspolicyer och inköpsprocedurer, etiska krav samt efterlevnad av relevanta lagar och regler.
* Strukturera och förhandla leverantörsavtal så att de uppfyller bankens krav på kostnadskontroll, långsiktighet och hållbarhet. Du kommer även säkerställa att viktiga frågor för banken är omhändertagna samt stötta avtalsägaren gällande leverantörsrelationer.
* Aktivt bidra till att utveckla verksamheten genom deltagande i utredningar och att driva olika aktiviteter.


 Du kommer att hamna mitt i en för banken viktig verksamhet. Nya, åtstramade regelverk ställer allt högre krav på information och kontroll av leverantörskedjan. Genom att arbeta på inköpsavdelningen får du en bra överblick av bankens samtliga verksamheter och du förväntas även skapa ett kontaktnät för att kunna vara effektiv i ditt arbete.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**Din profil**
 Vi söker dig som har förmåga att självständigt strukturera, planera och prioritera din tid så att påbörjade arbetsuppgifter slutförs inom givna deadlines. Du drivs av att sätta upp utmanande mål och arbetar ambitiöst för att uppnå målen med gott resultat. Vidare har du har lätt för att föra fram din talan och anpassar din kommunikation till målgruppen både på svenska och engelska, samt i tal och skrift. Vi ser gärna att du självständigt söker svar och lösningar samt har en vilja att ta ansvar för den egna utvecklingen. För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du har ett genuint intresse för inköpsprocessen samt förstår vikten av att samarbeta mot gemensamma mål.
   

  

 Krav för rollen:
   

  

* Akademisk examen inom Procurement & Supply Chain Management eller motsvarande utbildning.
* Minst ett par års erfarenhet av IT-inköp.
* Du har mycket god kunskap i svenska och engelska både i tal och skrift.
* Erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt är meriterande.


**Vi erbjuder**
* en trygg och stabil arbetsgivare
* dynamiskt och stimulerande arbete
* work-life balance
* kompetens- och karriärutveckling
* inkluderande- och jämställd arbetsmiljö
* konkurrenskraftigt förmånspaket

title: Senior Legal Advisor - Capital Box
description:
Multitude is a listed European FinTech company, offering digital lending and online banking services to consumers, small and medium-sized businesses, and other FinTechs. The services are provided through three independent business units, which are served by our internal Banking-as-a-Service Growth Platform. Multitude’s business units are consumer banking (Ferratum), business banking (CapitalBox) and wholesale banking (Multitude Bank).
   

  

 Multitude Group employs over 700 people in 25 countries and offers services in 16 countries, achieving a combined turnover of 230 million euros in 2023. Multitude was founded in Finland in 2005 and is listed on the Prime Standard segment of the Frankfurt Stock Exchange under the symbol 'E41'.
   

  

 We are seeking a highly skilled, dynamic, and experienced Senior Legal Advisor to join our team at CapitalBox, an SME lending leader. In this key role, you will be the legal cornerstone for our business, working closely with internal business teams and external partners, including clients and legal firms, to ensure the secure and compliant origination of debt facilities for small and medium enterprises.
   

  

 Your deep expertise in European legal frameworks, particularly in SME lending, combined with exceptional attention to detail and outstanding communication skills, will ensure smooth, efficient transactions that align with our regulatory and business needs. Collaboration across departments and a thorough understanding of the nuances in SME lending will be crucial for success in this role.
   

  

**Your Focus**
* Primary Liaison: Act as the primary liaison between CapitalBox and external legal firms, ensuring efficient and seamless origination of debt facilities for SMEs.
* SME Debt Origination: Oversee the diligent origination of debt facilities tailored for small and medium enterprises, ensuring full compliance with relevant legal and regulatory requirements.
* Legal Research and Analysis: Conduct comprehensive legal research and analysis to support debt origination activities specifically aimed at SMEs, with a focus on localized regulations affecting small businesses.
* European SME Lending Legal Landscape: Develop and maintain a deep understanding of the legal and regulatory environment across European countries, particularly in SME lending and securitization law.
* Cross-functional Collaboration: Collaborate closely with internal departments, including business units, finance, risk, and compliance, to ensure alignment on debt origination processes and regulatory requirements specific to SMEs.
* Document Review: Review and assess legal documents and agreements produced by external legal partners related to SME debt origination.
* Regulatory Compliance: Address pertinent legal and regulatory questions in SME lending with external legal firms and internal stakeholders.
* Expert Legal Advice: Provide expert legal advice on SME debt origination matters to senior management and other key decision-makers.
* Regulatory Monitoring: Monitor and communicate changes in laws and regulations affecting SME lending to internal teams, ensuring proactive compliance.
* Documentation Accuracy: Ensure all legal documentation is accurate, complete, and compliant with applicable laws, with a focus on SME loan agreements and securitization.
* Process Improvement: Continuously improve debt origination processes and procedures for better servicing the SME sector.
* Professionalism Under Pressure: Maintain professionalism and composure in high-pressure situations, especially when facing tight deadlines related to SME lending transactions.


**Your Background**
* M. degree or equivalent legal degree from a recognized institution.
* Valid legal qualification and ability to practice law in at least one European jurisdiction.
* Minimum of 10 years of experience in a legal role, with a focus on debt origination or related areas.
* Extensive experience in the origination and structuring of complex secured debt products/facilities.
* Strong knowledge of the legal and regulatory landscape in European countries, particularly in relation to debt facilities.
* Exceptional attention to detail and strong analytical skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively with internal and external stakeholders.
* Proven ability to align and collaborate with cross-functional teams.
* High level of integrity, professionalism, and ethical standards.
* Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
* Fluency in English is required; fluency in Multiple European Languages is preferred.
* Experience working in the banking or financial services industry.
* Proficiency in legal research tools and Microsoft Office Suite.


**What’s In It For You**
* Wellbeing benefit.
* Private Health Insurance & Private Pension Insurance.
* Other yearly Health benefits.
* Hybrid flexible working model.
* Access to LinkedIn learning with over 8000 courses.
* Share purchase matching program.
* Opportunities for growth, the realization of one's ideas, and further training.
* The opportunity to work in a dynamically international evolving company.
* Explore the world while you work with our two-month annual workation program, enabling you to work from multiple countries and embrace new cultures.


 Kindly note that by proceeding you will make your personal data provided available to us for the purposes of recruitment activities. By proceeding, you confirm that you have read and accepted our Recruitment Privacy Policy.

title: Oracle NetSuite Regional Director - Sales Development
description:
***This job is with Oracle, an inclusive employer and a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community. Please do not contact the recruiter directly.***
**Why Oracle** 
**NetSuite**
 Founded in 1998, Oracle NetSuite was the first cloud company – ushering in the new era of cloud computing. NetSuite’s mission is to deliver one system, the suite, that gives leaders a complete view into their business.
   

  

 As the industry leading cloud business system recognised in Gartner’s Magic Quadrants, NetSuite includes financials, inventory management, HR, professional services automation, commerce, and more. Tens of thousands of customers all over the world trust NetSuite to give their businesses the visibility, agility, and control needed to make data-informed decisions quickly.
   

  

 NetSuite is a place where you can build a career and have fun while doing so! We’re invested in our people, our customers, and the community. And as part of Oracle, our benefits are second to none. Joining our passionate team means that you’re ready to take your career to the next level. With priceless learning opportunities, strong support, incredible innovation, and volunteer opportunities, NetSuite is committed to creating a workplace where everyone feels empowered and set up for success.
   

  

  

  

**The Oracle NetSuite Sales Development Organisation**
 The Sales Development Organisation provides Sales Development Representatives with a hands-on experience qualifying leads while building product knowledge and developing fundamental sales skills. Within this role, SDRs get the best of both worlds – training and autonomy. The SDR role provides an unmissable, hands-on learning opportunity that will allow them to contribute to our ongoing success.
   

  

 We are looking to hire our next superstar Regional Director to help us continue to accelerate our YoY growth through revenue generation. This Regional Director will coach and develop their management and SDRs, support the sales leadership in the region to meet targets, and work with recruiting to hit annual hiring goals.
   

  

 As such this senior position requires a strong, hands-on leader who has experience in inside sales or SDR programs and strong analytical skills.
 **Extensive management experience is essential.** 
 They will also have significant experience engaging with sales leaders over their sales execution strategy and how their SDRs can accelerate achievement of this.
   

  

**Want to know more? Check out these resources.**
* NetSuite Instagram
* NetSuite Website
* NetSuite Customer Testimonials
* NetSuite LinkedIn Page
* NetSuite YouTube Channel


 Career Level - M3
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* Setting expectations with senior sales management through timely and accurate forecasting, pipeline and sales activity/program metrics reporting
* Motivating individuals to succeed through impassioned leadership, coaching, creative sales incentives, and broadcast of results
* Developing plans to foster a competitive and collaborative team environment
* Driving program and participant success; investing in the success of the team and going above and beyond to mentor a team of individuals
* Owning the recruiting process for future SDRs and management
* Refining and critiquing processes and ensuring adherence within the team and with stakeholders
* Creating and developing programs and campaigns in conjunction with Sales - should be able to execute programs and campaigns with limited guidance
* Managing day-to-day activities of the team
* Serving as an active coach through feedback sessions
* Preparing SDRs for regular reviews with the NetSuite senior management team
* Acquiring and maintaining a working knowledge of the complete capabilities of NetSuite's service offerings
* Collaborating with peers globally


**Minimum Qualifications**
* Native level of Swedish + fluency in English (additional languages advantageous)
* Strong background in sales development, inside sales and/or sales management required, second-line management experience an advantage
* Intelligent, motivated and competitive with a “roll-up-the-sleeves” and “get the job done” attitude
* Excellent communication (verbal, written, and presentation) and interpersonal skills (outgoing and personable)
* Experience engaging with sales over revenue strategy and creating alignment and campaigns to accelerate their achievement of goals
* Inspires a team focused, collaborative and positive environment
* Passion for coaching and mentoring emerging sales talent
* Experience giving both positive and constructive feedback
* Completely invested in driving both individual contributor and team success
* Desire to work in tech industry with a growing company
* Excellent organisational, prioritisation, and time management skills
* Focused on driving a team to collective lead generation quotas/goals
* Ability to create and track individual and team metrics
* Creative self-starter
* University degree required


**Life At Oracle And Equal Opportunity**
 An Oracle career can span industries, roles, countries, and cultures, giving you the opportunity to flourish in new roles and innovate, while blending work life in. Oracle has thrived through 40+ years of change by innovating and operating with integrity while delivering for the top companies in almost every industry.
   

  

 In order to nurture the talent that makes this happen, we are committed to an inclusive culture that celebrates and values diverse insights and perspectives, a workforce that inspires thought leadership and innovation.
   

  

 Oracle offers a highly competitive suite of Employee Benefits designed on the principles of parity, consistency, and affordability. The overall package includes certain core elements such as Medical, Life Insurance, access to Retirement Planning, and much more. We also encourage our employees to engage in the culture of giving back to the communities where we live and do business.
   

  

 At Oracle, we believe that innovation starts with diversity and inclusion and to create the future we need talent from various backgrounds, perspectives, and abilities. We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to successfully participate in the job application, interview process, and in potential roles to perform crucial job functions. That’s why we’re committed to creating a workforce where all individuals can do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued that we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before.
   

  

 Disclaimer: Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer\*. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.
   

  

 https://www.oracle.com/corporate/careers/diversity-inclusion/
   

  

 As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s problems. True innovation starts with diverse perspectives and various abilities and backgrounds.
   

  

 When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.
   

  

 We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.
   

  

 Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer a highly competitive suite of employee benefits designed on the principles of parity and consistency. We put our people first with flexible medical, life insurance and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.
   

  

 We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by calling +1 888 404 2494, option one.
   

  

**Disclaimer**
 Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer\*. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.

title: Supporttekniker på deltid!
description:
Vi söker just nu två engagerade och utåtriktade studenter för ett deltidsuppdrag fram till sommaren 2025. Vi ser gärna att du som kandidat vill ta ägandeskap för ditt arbete, besitter ett starkt inre driv och en vilja att utvecklas, både i rollen och som en del av teamet!
 



  

**Plats :**
 Danderyd
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Deltid, cirka 20 tim/vecka
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Omgående
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Vår kund är en ledande aktör inom medicinteknik och e-hälsolösningar som utvecklar teknik som effektiviserar vårdflöden globalt - detta är din chans att vara med och bidra till en produkt som direkt hjälper vården och dina medmänniskor! Trots deras ledande position på marknaden är de ett mindre bolag med cirka 30-40 anställda där avdelningarna jobbar nära och samarbetar med varandra. Bolaget genomgår just nu en nyuppbyggnad med en tydlig vision att sträva framåt i sin utveckling och struktur!
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Ett konsultuppdrag på deltid - cirka 20 tim/vecka (50%). Det initiala uppdraget beräknas pågå till juni 2025 men det finns möjlighet till förlängning även under och efter sommaren.
  
* En fadder på plats som ansvarar för upplärning och on-boarding av teknikerna
  
* En dedikerad konsultchef som finns tillgänglig för bland annat stöttning i karriären
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Ärendehantering och support
  
* Felsökning
  
* IT-drift och underhåll
  
* Systeminstallation- och uppdateringar
  
* Kundkontakt och fältsupport - fysiska besök ute hos kund för att uppdatera mjukvara
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Är studerande på eftergymnasial nivå på minst 50% med examen tidigast sommaren 2025.
  
* Har ett stort intresse för IT och service
  
* Har B-körkort (manuell)
  
* Kan kommunicera professionellt på svenska och obehindrat på engelska.
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande om du har**



  

  
* Studerar en eftergymnasial utbildning mot IT- eller datavetenskap
  
* Erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med eller mot regioner
   

 Kunskap kan erhållas genom utbildning, erfarenhet eller att vara självlärd.
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Kommunikativ
  
* Självgående
  
* Flexibel
  
* Samarbetsinriktad
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Agnes Lekenhed eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stv2@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15108157

title: System Test Engineer to Life-Science start-up
description:
Here you have the opportunity to be a part of something special! Our partner has rapidly expanded its business, achieving remarkable success in the field of life sciences. They are developing a cutting-edge life science product that will revolutionize the industry. Now, they are seeking a System Test Engineer to join their dedicated team of experts. If you are passionate about pushing boundaries and working with groundbreaking technology in the research field, this is the opportunity you've been waiting for.
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Solna
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Technology
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time, on site
 



  

**Start date :**
 As soon as possible
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
   




**About the role**

 Our partner continues their road to greatness and have quickly expanded their business to scale their success-story, developing a state-of-the-art life science product. You will be part of a hard-working organisation that every day gives their best to experiment and develop new-thinking technology within the research area. You will be instrumental in testing the new products and systems acting as the interface between the Software Team and the System Team.
 


  


 Through your work you will be of an important role to the start-up. You work in a cross-functional position where your detail-oriented and systematic approach is of great value to future development of the products and the organisation.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* To be a part of a company with the ambition the achieve great success
  
* Working closely with a senior colleagues with high level of competence
  
* A dedicated partnership with your Consultant Manager
  

  


**Work tasks**
  
* Defining and refining smoke tests of the software
  
* Defining regression testing for new software releases
  
* Writing test cases and test plans
  
* Executing tests, reporting bugs and writing test reports
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* MSc Technical biology, Molecular Biotechnology, Engineering Physics, Mechanical engineering or similar
  
* Work-life experience of system level testing, preferably of Life science instrumentation containing SW and HW
  
* Product development experience, preferably within the Life science space
  
* Experience from working hands on in labs or similar environment
  
* Strong proficiency in English, both verbally and in writing
  


  


  

**It is meritorious if you have**



  

  
* Previous experience of working system verification and validation
  
* Worked with test creation and execution planning in Jira
  
* Strong proficiency in Swedish, both verbally and in writing
  


  


  

**To succeed in the role, your personal skills are:**



  


 We are looking for candidates that enjoy working in a goal-oriented environment and in projects with multi-functional teams involved. The right candidate is detail-oriented and values a systematic and structured way of working.
 


  


 It is important to have solid communication skills and a flexible mindset. To succeed in the role you have strong teamwork skills and an analytical and pragmatic approach. You are friendly, positive, and fun to work with and you enjoy working in a fast-paced and changing environment.
 


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Erik Gund or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on sth4@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15107146

title: Project Manager, Data Center Construction
description:
**Introducing evroc**
 At evroc, we are building a secure, sovereign, and sustainable hyperscale cloud to reimagine the digital future of Europe. By joining our company, you have an exciting opportunity to contribute to the development of next-generation cloud services. We are seeking intellectually curious and highly motivated team members who are ready to embrace the thrilling challenge of building the first European owned hyperscale cloud.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Job type:** 
 Permanent position
   

  

**The Role**
 We are seeking an experienced Project Manager to lead the construction and implementation of our landmark data center facility near Stockholm, and subsequent facilities across Europe. This role offers an exciting opportunity to oversee a complex, large-scale project from inception to completion.
   

  

**What You'll Tackle**
* Lead end-to-end project management of data center construction, including planning, scheduling, budgeting, and resource allocation.
* Coordinate with architects, engineers, contractors, and vendors throughout all project phases.
* Manage project risks, dependencies, and contingencies.
* Ensure compliance with building codes, safety regulations, and industry standards.
* Oversee quality control processes and construction milestones.
* Direct and coordinate multiple stakeholders and cross-functional teams.
* Develop and maintain project documentation, timelines, and progress reports.
* Manage project budget and control costs.
* Conduct regular site inspections and progress meetings.


**Skills We Value**
* Typically 5+ years of experience in construction project management, specifically in data center or mission-critical facility projects.
* Degree in Construction Management, Engineering, or related field.
* Proven track record of successfully delivering large-scale data center construction projects
* Experience in Swedish building codes and regulations.
* Strong understanding of data center infrastructure, including mechanical, electrical, and cooling systems and latest trends.
* PMP certification or equivalent experience.
* Expert knowledge of construction methodologies, building systems, and industry standards, as well as sustainable construction practices.
* Strong risk management, problem-solving and communication.
* Fluent English; fluent Swedish advantageous but not required.


 We offer a competitive salary and an equity package to attract the best. Whether it’s the cosmopolitan allure of London, the vibrant Stockholm, or the Mediterranean charm of Sophia Antipolis, you’re poised for an inspiring work environment and a captivating local culture!
   

  

 At evroc, diversity is our strength. We champion an inclusive environment where every background - ethnicity, age, gender identity, beliefs, and culture - is celebrated.
   

  

 If this role doesn't quite match what you're looking for, feel free to apply to us via our open application.

title: Data Analyst for Ventures and New Business
description:
**About Us**
 Everyone working at Scania is united by a common purpose: Driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. We know that the transport industry must change, and it’s a change we want to lead. Scania’s continuous transformative work within circularity, electrification and autonomy shows commercial ideas, powerful insights and competencies that make real change happen.
   

  

 Ventures and New Business at Scania have a key role in driving the shift and contributing to this vision. We develop and deliver new businesses, supporting Scania’s long-term growth and profitability ambitions. At Ventures and New Business, we develop complementing solutions to our core and build new growth through ventures and investments that strengthen and support our acceleration, driving the shift. We want to engage and inspire our entire organisation to create results together with us, and collaboration and entrepreneurial spirit are part of our culture and what makes us successful.
   

  

 We are today a team of approximate 45+ people and have five ventures. Our office space is very central at Drottninggatan in Stockholm.
   

  

**Job Description**
 As a Venture Data Analyst you will play a crucial role in supporting the growth and success of new business ventures by providing actionable insights through data analysis. By collecting, analysing, and interpreting data you will help guide strategic decisions and optimise business performance.
   

  

 Reporting to our Tech Domain Manager, you will be aligned with one of our ventures while also working closely with other colleagues within your domain to share expertise and best practices.
   

  

 Key responsibilities
   

  

 In the role of Data Analyst for a venture your key responsibilites will be:
   

  

  

* Data Collection and Management: Gathering, cleaning, and maintaining data from various sources to ensure accuracy and reliability for analysis.
* Data Analysis: Conducting thorough data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that inform business strategies and decision-making.
* Reporting and Visualisation: Creating clear and compelling reports, dashboards, and visualisations to communicate analytical findings to stakeholders.
* Performance Monitoring: Tracking key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to monitor the health and progress of business ventures.
* Market Research: Conducting market research and competitor analysis to provide context and support strategic planning.
* Collaboration: Working closely with cross-functional teams, including product development, marketing, and finance, to align data insights with business objectives.
* Recommendations: Providing actionable recommendations based on data analysis to help optimise operations, improve customer experience, and drive growth.


**About You**
 We seek someone with strong experience within data analytics. It is important that you are a positive influence and a good collaborator as you will interact with a wide array of internal and external stakeholders. Good communication skills are also key since you will be interacting closely with business executives both across the company and externally. You are a goal-oriented doer and a team player that loves to see how our business is growing.
   

  

 We also believe that you (requirements):
   

  

  

* Have a master’s degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics or similar field.
* Bring 3+ years of experience in the analytics field, experience within the logistic industry is a plus.
* Possess a high degree of autonomy and can work independently on complex analyses.
* Have a solid and broad analytical skills-set including the ability to use statistical methods.
* Are proficient in using data extraction tools.
* Have experience working with BI tools such as QlikSense or Tableau.
* Thrive in in a fast-growing company.
* Are fluent in English


 What we offer:
   

  

 We offer you the chance to be part of an organisation that is focused on reaching Scania’s targets and truly driving the shift to a sustainable transport system. Joining our team you will get to enjoy the flexibility and agility of a startup enviroment while benefiting from the stability and security of being employed by one of Sweden's largest companies. With the opportunities of the current transformative changes within the transport industry, we are on a very exciting journey. This is the right time to join us!
   

  

 Information and application
   

  

 Questions about the role? Contact linda.rosenqvist@scania.com
   

  

 We are working with an ongoing selection; please apply as soon as possible if you are interested, but no later than 2024-10-31.
   

  

 Kindly note that a background check might be conducted for this position.
   

  

*Scania is one of Sweden's largest companies and offers trucks and buses for heavy transport in combination with a wide range of product-related services. Our mission is to drive the transition to a sustainable transport system by developing safe, smart and energy-efficient transport solutions that are better for both people and our planet. Today, Scania have around 50,000 employees in around 100 countries. For more information visit Scania.com*

title: Test Lead
description:
**Note: Only candidates fluent in Swedish will be considered.
   

  

 Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Type:** 
 Full-Time, Permanent
   

  

**Salary:** 
 Up to 80,000 SEK
   

  

**Who Will You Be Working For?**
 Our client, a top consultancy in Stockholm, is on the lookout for a Test Leader with a knack for planning, coordination, and ensuring top-quality testing. If you have a passion for guiding test projects, a solid grasp of both manual and automated testing, and are fluent in Swedish, this is your chance to shine!
   

  

**What Your Day Would Look Like**
* Test Strategist: Oversee test projects, from manual to automated testing, ensuring all testing activities are planned, executed, and reported with precision.
* Coordinator Extraordinaire: Manage coordination between teams, handle project follow-ups, and ensure smooth communication.
* Knowledge Sharer: Share your expertise with the team and organization, fostering a culture of continuous improvement.
* Quality Guardian: Ensure that testing processes are meticulous, responsible, and uphold the highest quality standards.
* Tech Savvy: Utilize tools like Jira or other agile tools, Zephyr/Xray for test management, and handle CI/CD processes efficiently.


**To Apply, You’ll Need:**
* Experience: Several years managing test projects with both manual and automated tests, including experience with system integrations.
* Skills: Strong planning, follow-up, and reporting skills. Ability to work with Jira, Zephyr/Xray, and familiarity with Agile/Scrum/Kanban methodologies.
* Certification: ISTQB certification is essential.
* Tools: Hands-on experience with writing, maintaining, and executing test cases.
* Language: Fluent Swedish is a must.


**Why You’ll Love It:**
* Impact: Play a crucial role in shaping the quality of high-impact software and systems.
* Culture: Be part of a dynamic, collaborative team in the heart of Stockholm.
* Perks: Competitive salary, excellent benefits, and an engaging work environment.

title: ALTEN Stockholm söker Logistiktekniker
company_industry: Business Consulting and Services and Automation Machinery Manufacturing
description:
**Är du en driven logistiktekniker som vill ta nästa steg i karriären?** 




 Vi på ALTEN Stockholm söker nu en engagerad Logistiktekniker till en av våra största kunder. Om du brinner för att utveckla, effektivisera och följa upp logistikprocesser, samt gillar att arbeta nära linjeorganisationen, då är detta möjligheten för dig!
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som Logistiktekniker kommer du att:
 



  




* **Planera och genomföra logistikprojekt** 
 i nära samarbete med linjeorganisationen.
* **Utveckla, effektivisera och följa upp** 
 flöden, planeringspunkter/buffertnivåer och arbetssätt inom logistikprocesser.
* **Bevaka utvecklingen** 
 inom produktionslogistik och medverka till införandet av nya metoder.
* **Engagera och involvera** 
 medarbetare i olika projekt för att tillsammans förbättra verksamheten genom olika system.



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




 På ALTEN är varje individ lika värdefull när vi utvecklar morgondagens värld idag. Vi erbjuder dig:
 



  




* Tekniska utmaningar: Arbeta med spännande projekt hos våra ledande kunder.
* Personlig utveckling: Tillgång till en individuell utbildningsbudget för interna eller externa kurser genom vår ALTEN Academy.
* Inspirerande gemenskap: Delta i våra interna nätverk som ALTEN Sports och Women@ALTEN, samt våra Tech Weeks där du kan dela erfarenheter och inspireras av kollegor.
* Coachande ledarskap: Våra ledare guidar dig i din karriärutveckling och stöttar dig mot dina mål.
* Bidra till en hållbar framtid: Var med och påverka genom projekt som bidrar till hållbar utveckling.



  





**Vem vi söker** 




 Vi söker dig som har:
 



  





**Utbildning** 
 : Högskole- eller civilingenjörsexamen inom industriell ekonomi, logistik eller motsvarande.
 



  





**Erfarenhet** 
 :
 


* Arbetslivserfarenhet inom inköp och logistik.
* Du har arbetat ett par år, men även nyexaminerade är välkomna att söka.



  





**Kompetenser** 
 :
 


* Förmåga att bygga bra nätverk och relationer.
* God ledarskapsförmåga.
* Engagerad och drivande med förmåga att fördjupa dig i detaljer samt tänka ur ett helhetsperspektiv.



  





**Personliga egenskaper** 
 :
 


* Kommunikativ och utåtriktad.
* Analytisk och problemlösande.
* Initiativrik och resultatorienterad.



  





**Om ALTEN** 




 ALTEN är ett av Europas största konsultbolag inom teknik, IT och Life Sciences med över
 **57 000** 
 anställda i fler än 30 länder. Vi är en global aktör med lokal närvaro, med kollegor från Lund i söder till Skellefteå i norr. Våra ingenjörer utför komplexa och högteknologiska projekt genom hela produktutvecklingskedjan hos ledande företag inom branscher såsom Fordon, Flyg & Försvar, Energi, Industri, Offentlig sektor och Life Sciences.
 



  





 För fjärde året i rad har ALTEN utsetts till en av Sveriges mest attraktiva arbetsgivare av Karriärföretagen, en utmärkelse för arbetsgivare som erbjuder unika karriär- och utvecklingsmöjligheter.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Är du redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär och bli en del av vårt inspirerande team? Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! Rekryteringsprocessen sker löpande, så skicka in din ansökan redan idag.

title: Second line supporttekniker sökes!
description:
**Din vardag:**
 Som 2nd line supporttekniker fokuserar du på djupare felsökningar av ärenden som eskalerats från 1st line-supporten. Du kan även hantera 3rd line-ärenden och stötta dina kollegor. Ditt arbete inkluderar teknisk support och felsökning av både kundspecifika och standardapplikationer i Windowsmiljö, såsom Microsoft Office 365 och Microsoft Entra ID. Du kommer också att arbeta med kontohantering i Active Directory samt övervakning och felsökning av nätverk och skrivare.
   

  

 Du är anställd av Wise IT och arbetar hos en av våra kunder i Stockholm. Vi matchar uppdrag baserat på din bakgrund och dina karriärmål.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Du är en problemlösare som trivs med djupare felsökningar och att hjälpa användare med IT-relaterade frågor. Du har erfarenhet av servicedesk eller IT-support och är redo för nästa steg i karriären. Som person är du proaktiv, serviceminded och tar ansvar för ditt arbete. Vi söker dig med några års erfarenhet inom:
   

  

* Servicedesk/1-2nd line
* Installation och konfiguration
* Felsökning inom Microsoft 365 och Mac-plattformar
* Microsoft Server
* SCCM
* VMware och Hyper-V


**Passar vi för dig?**
 Wise IT arbetar med kompetensförsörjning inom IT och strävar efter att matcha rätt kompetens med rätt uppdrag. Vill du veta mer om vår kultur och våra värderingar? Besök vår karriärsida.

title: ALTEN Industry söker Elektronik- och Hårdvarudesigningenjör!
description:
**Är du passionerad för elektronik och produktutveckling?** 




 Vi på ALTEN Industry söker en engagerad Elektronik- och Hårdvarudesigningenjör som vill vara med och utveckla framtidens teknik. Om du har ett stort tekniskt intresse, gillar utmaningar och att lösa problem tillsammans med andra, då är du den vi söker!
 



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




  




* **Spännande tekniska utmaningar:** 
 Arbeta med banbrytande teknik inom områden som autonoma fordon, elektrifiering och trådlös kommunikation.
* **Personlig utveckling:** 
 Tillgång till en individuell utbildningsbudget för interna eller externa kurser genom vår
 **ALTEN Academy** 
 .
* **Inspirerande gemenskap:** 
 Delta i våra interna nätverk och evenemang där du kan dela erfarenheter och inspireras av kollegor.
* **Balans mellan arbete och fritid:** 
 Vi erbjuder tre extra lediga dagar per år samt förmåner som pensionsplan, försäkringar och friskvårdsbidrag.
* **Coachande ledarskap:** 
 Våra ledare guidar dig i din karriärutveckling och stöttar dig mot dina mål.
* **Bidra till en hållbar framtid:** 
 Var med och påverka genom projekt som bidrar till hållbar utveckling.



  





**Din roll som Elektronik-/Mekatronikingenjör** 




 Som Elektronik-/Mekatronikingenjör hos oss kommer du att:
 



  




* **Utveckla avancerad teknik** 
 tillsammans med mekanikingenjörer, firmware- och mjukvaruutvecklare.
* **Bidra med expertis** 
 inom design, kvalitet, produktion och inköp.
* **Delta i hela produktkedjan** 
 , från design av kompletta produkter till leverans.
* **Ansvara för mekatronikdesign** 
 , inklusive schematisk design, komponentval, leverantörskontakter, testning, produktionsstöd och certifieringar.
* **Arbeta med mjukvaruimplementering** 
 , felsökning och testning av mekatroniska system.



  





**Möjlighet att arbeta inom områden som** 
 :
 



  




* Hög-/lågspänning
* Design och programmering av mikrokontrollersystem
* PCB-design med mjukvaror som Altium



  





 Du kommer att spela en nyckelroll i projekt från konceptfas till att produkten når marknaden, med en kombination av nyutveckling och produktunderhåll.
 



  





**Vem vi söker** 




 Vi söker ingenjörer på alla erfarenhetsnivåer, från juniora med några års erfarenhet till mycket seniora.
 



  





**Mekatronikingenjör:** 



* **God kunskap** 
 inom utveckling, felsökning och testning av mekatroniska system.
* **Färdigheter i C/C++** 
 och firmwareutveckling.



  





**Meriterande:** 



* Kunskap om bränsleceller, batteripack och e-mobilitet.
* Erfarenhet av CAD-verktyg som Altium Designer och OrCAD.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av mätverktyg som oscilloskop, spektrumanalysator och nätverksanalysator.
* Viss kunskap i programmering (VHDL, MATLAB/Simulink).



  





**Elektronik-/Hårdvarudesigningenjör:** 



* **God kunskap** 
 inom elektronikdesign och elektroniksverifiering.
* Meriterande om du tidigare har utvecklat kompletta produkter, från idé till volymproduktion.



  





**Om ALTEN** 




 ALTEN är ett av Europas största konsultbolag inom teknik, IT och Life Sciences med över 57 000 anställda i mer än 30 länder. Vi är en global aktör med lokal närvaro med 1 400 engagerade kollegor i Sverige, från Lund i söder till Skellefteå i norr. Våra ingenjörer utför komplexa och högteknologiska projekt genom hela produktutvecklingskedjan hos de mest prestigefyllda företagen inom branscher som Fordon, Flyg & Försvar, Energi, Industri, Offentlig sektor och Life Sciences.
 



  





 För fyra år i rad har ALTEN utsetts till en av
 **Sveriges mest attraktiva arbetsgivare** 
 av Karriärföretagen, en utmärkelse för arbetsgivare som erbjuder unika karriär- och utvecklingsmöjligheter.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Är du redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär och bli en del av vårt inspirerande team? Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! Rekryteringsprocessen sker löpande, så skicka in din ansökan redan idag.

title: Software Engineer - Connectivity Platform
description:
**Tink was founded in 2012, and a decade later became part of Visa in 2022. Tink was created with the aim of changing the banking industry for the better. We have built Europe’s most robust open banking platform – with the broadest, deepest connectivity and powerful services that create value out of the financial data. We offer the tools that allow anyone – from big banks and fintechs to startups – to build the future of financial services across Europe.**
 Tink is building an open banking platform that enables banks, fintechs and startups to develop data-driven financial services. Through one API, Tink allows customers to access aggregated financial data, initiate payments, enrich transactions and build personal finance management tools. Tink connects to more than 3,400 banks that reach over 250 million bank customers across Europe. Our solutions are ready-to-go products, each developed to solve specific problems and bring value to both businesses and their customers.
   

  

 As a Software Engineer at Tink, you will be part of driving the change in how everyone perceives banking and financial services for the better. We are looking for people who want to have an impact. In your team, at Tink, in the industry.
   

  

 Engineering at Tink is also an inspirational group, where knowledge sharing and learning from each other is part of the culture to encourage everyone to develop and progress themselves.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Work with Tink’s technologies which is mainly Java, AWS, Kubernetes, Docker, Kafka, MySQL, Cassandra, Datadog, gRPC and much more.
* Drive our reliable, scalable and highly distributed open banking products to different markets using your technical expertise
* Innovate around new features and measure how these features perform, being instrumental in bringing the product vision to life
* Collaborate and build high-quality products by following best engineering practices


**What We Offer You**
 Tink offers you a dynamic work environment where you can grow and develop your skills, with opportunities for career advancement. You will have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology and innovative solutions. This together with a team of experienced professionals who are passionate about creating products that make a difference.
   

  

 Through our yearly salary review we make sure to keep Tinkers’ salaries adjusted to market trends and inflation. Our employees don’t need to change jobs in order to get a fair salary increase!
   

  

 We provide personal development reviews and plans twice a year so that everyone has a chance to discuss their opportunities, growth and potential.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
 We are looking for a Software Engineer with experience of building innovative and scalable products. You understand the trade-offs of speed vs quality on technical decisions and look at problems from different angles. You also invest time in your own, and the team's development to build up your overall knowledge.
   

  

 We would like you to have
   

  

* Proven experience working with Java technologies
* Experience with a fast-paced environment that is product centric
* Experience from working with DevOps methodologies and tools
* Experience working with agile methodologies and understand the value of tracking engineering key metrics


 This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 days a week (determined by leadership/site), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.
   

  

*Who we are at Tink*
 We are a company of developers and engineers – it’s in our DNA to imagine, build and iterate. We were founded with a vision of transforming an industry that lacked competition and momentum. And we have built a company of passionate over-achievers who all believe there is always a better way of doing things.
   

  

 People from all over Europe – and the world – have joined us on our mission to build the biggest and best open banking platform in Europe.
   

  

 We're looking forward to your application!

title: Platform Owner | Dynamics365 F&O | Retail Operations Solution & Support
description:
**Job ID:** R0009710


**Date posted:** 29/10/2024


Being able to offer IKEA products to as many people as possible across the globe is a challenge we love. Would you like to join our wonderful team that make it happen?


We are seeking a skilled Platform Owner to join our team at Retail Operation Solution and Support (ROSS). We are on a tremendous journey to replace Business Central and LS Central as our base ERP core digital retail offer with D365 Finance & Operation, D365 Commerce, D365 Customer Engagement, D365 Field service and different power platform apps. To support in this transition, we are seeking a Platform Owner for Dynamics 365 F&O.

**About the Role**


We are looking for an ERP Infrastructure Platform Owner. This platform is based upon Microsoft Dynamics 365 ERP and Microsoft Power Platform with Azure cloud as enabling SaaS infrastructure. The platform is considered a core enabler for the product teams that deliver digital products capabilities.


As a Platform Owner in ROSS, you are responsible for maximizing the business value resulting from the development and operation of the digital platform, also ensuring required technologies, toolsets and supporting services, by making trade-off decisions as needed. Ensuring the platform team(s) has a good understanding of the platform roadmap and vision as defined in collaboration with the Platform Manager, to drive the creation and prioritization of the backlog associated with the platform.


You are involved in sprint planning meetings to help provide clarity and elaborate features and user stories to help the team(s) better understand the requirements and how success will be measured. You define and deliver acceptance criteria and the ‘Definition of Done’ working collaboratively with the rest of the team.


You drive consistency in practice, process, toolset, and architecture across platforms and work with relevant stakeholders including product teams to understand and qualify their needs and requirements, ensuring they are included and integrated into the platform as needed. We have transitioned into a more product and platform oriented organization set up, whilst migrating and implementing IKEA application customisations, so we work in a more clear way can separate platform layer and product layer.


You act as a infrastructure and platform subject matter expert for the team, providing insight, context, and additional information as needed to help the understanding of what is required and you will work collaboratively with platform specific architects, specialists and other Platform & Product Owners across Core Business Franchise and Inter IKEA Group to refine the backlog and identify cross journey dependencies within cross-functional teams to ensure that the agile/product team(s) have what they need and remove blockers that may prevent them to maximize the delivery of digital products on the platform by leading, supporting and secure a competent and high performing platform team, through internal and external sourcing.

**About you**


We are looking for someone who likes making the complex simple and who believes in working together as one team. We believe that you are delivery-focused with excellent attention to detail and drive to resolve issues. You get energy from working in a product-oriented organization based on agile principles and ways of working. You are also passionate about enabling ‘a better everyday life’ through technology, digital innovation, and empowered teams.

**Qualifications**


To be successful in this role, the following knowledge, skills, and experiences would be valuable:

* A minimum of 3-5 years of progressive and diverse experience managing the operations and on-going platform and infrastructure development and maintenance of digital core systems, solutions and platforms in a global retail organisation or recent IKEA experience in retail or value chain.
* Solid experience of platforms, architecture, and information management. Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Power Platforms is essential.
* Relevant and up-to-date Microsoft Dynamics 365 ERO and Power Platform Certifications, and some experience from other Microsoft Azure Platform Services (e.g., WebApp, Azure SQL, Azure Integration Services) is also an asset but not a must.
* Demonstrable experience in working in an Agile or DevOps working set-up with various technology platforms and experience in understanding the needs of customers or clients (internal or external) with proven analytical skills and experience making decisions based on hard and soft data.
* You know how to set up, manage and track progress for software development in accordance with agile frameworks and methodologies.
* Knowledge about the process of documenting, analyzing, tracing prioritizing and agreeing on requirements with control over change and communication with relevant stakeholders.
* Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build trustful relationships with stakeholders of different seniority levels across the organisation and across markets, a structured mindset and the ability to perceive the bigger picture along with the underlying details.
* Strong facilitation, communication and documented leadership skills and the ability to deliver in times of change and uncertainty, with the business goals, customers and co-workers in focus.
* You have a cloud first mindset and believe DevOps and automation are keys to success.


About us


Our vision, to create a better everyday life for the many people, influences everything we do. It is a vision that lives in the everyday efforts of all co-workers, all over the world.


Retail Operation Solutions & Support is an integral part of Inter IKEA Retail Concept and consists of a team of people with a passion for retail and competence in business and technology. We are moving into a new chapter with an ambition to provide IKEA retailers with a set of digital products and services that are integrated into the IKEA value chain and support the omnichannel IKEA Concept. We call this the Core digital retail offer and it covers key capabilities for retail operations. Currently our retail package is mainly used by the non INGKA retailers.

 **More Information**  

At IKEA we believe that we’re better when we’re physically together for collaboration, dialogues, and conversations. We believe in the power of human interactions; the informal chats, the energy, belonging, and creativity generated by people being in the same place. Our approach is that we spend most of our time in the IKEA workplace and with the flexibility to work from home when relevant.


This is a full-time role (40 hours per week) located in Malmö, Sweden. You will report to the Platform Manager in ROSS.


10th November is the closing date to apply for this role. Please send your application – CV and motivation – in English and let us know why you would be a good fit. We look forward to hearing from you!


At IKEA, we are looking for people who believe everyone deserves a seat at the table. You’re welcome no matter where you come from, what you believe, and what you look like. We don’t even care how you have furnished your home. We’re interested in you simply because you’re you. Even if your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. We believe that people’s different perspectives, backgrounds, and personalities make us better at understanding our customers dreams and needs. At IKEA, we’re all on the same project.
company_description: At IKEA, we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”.

title: Data Scientist, Solna
description:
*We seek to strengthen our position and increase the speed of the implementation of data science, machine learning and AI solutions in PostNord. We are looking for three Data Scientists who will play an important role in helping PostNord to become an AI and data driven business. We offer you a cutting-edge Analytics environment, very competent colleagues as well as good benefits and a really cool office. Apply now to the Data Scientist role!*

**Join us**
-----------


The Technology Acceleration area with Group IT is responsible for establishing the future IT landscape that will be the foundation for PostNord' s continued AI and data driven journey. PostNord is the leader of logistics and postal services in the Nordics. As a Data Scientist at PostNord you will engage in projects, combining technical expertise within areas such data collection and exploration, model development and model deployment and operation. As a Data Scientist, you will are able to independently develop and deploy models, both statistical and machine learning. We are looking for data scientists for our existing ML team which delivers production volume forecast to PostNords business and we are also looking for data scientists to our newly formed AI- and Concept development teams. It is our goal to deploy efficient and accurate models and keep the models up to date through a set of well-defined MLOps practices.

**Job duties**
--------------

* Work in an agile team to deliver the best possible data solutions for PostNord.
* Identify, prepare, explore and analyze data from various data sets.
* Understand the business requirements and develop ML solutions accordingly.
* Ensure best practices, such as quality and security, are followed in all stages of the product development life cycle.
* Identify, collect and analyze data and train new ML models.
* Collaborate within team boundaries aiming to share knowledge and best practices.
* Keeps up to date with data science trends in and outside of PostNord.
* Sound knowledge of statistics and machine learning.
* take ownership of the teams solutions whether new or old and help establish best in class MLOps .

**We are looking for you who have**
-----------------------------------

* A bachelor's degree or higher in computer science, mathematics, statistics, or a related field.
* At least 3-5 years of work experience
* Proficiency in Python and at least one of the following frameworks: TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, or Scikit-learn.
* Sound knowledge of statistics
* Strong knowledge of machine learning concepts and techniques, such as supervised and unsupervised learning, classification, regression, clustering, feature engineering, and model evaluation.
* Experience in applying machine learning methods to real-world data sets and problems, preferably in the domain of production forecasting or time series analysis.
* Understanding of core AI and ML concepts, algorithms, and their applications
* Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders, and to translate business requirements into data-driven solutions.
* Experience in working with time series data and using frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, or Keras for building and training neural network models for forecasting or anomaly detection.

**Your profile as an Data Scientist**
-------------------------------------


You have worked with statistical analysis and Machine Learning solutions in an agile team before. You like to work hands on, and to work directly with our business stakeholders. You have an academic background and as a person you are curious to learn and evolve your skill set in accordance with the state-of-the-art pace in the domain that you work in.

### **Meritorious experience: (Nice-to-have)**

* Experience in developing and deploying end-to-end machine learning pipelines in cloud-based environments (Azure preferred) using tools such as MLflow, Azure ML Studio and Azure DevOps.
* Experience in working with cloud platforms (Azure preferred) and using their services for data storage, processing, and analysis.
* Data visualisation experience; preferably in Power BI
* Prior experience implementing generative AI/LLM’s or ML.
* Experience in applying DevOps principles and practices to machine learning projects, such as version control, testing, continuous integration, and continuous delivery.
* Experience in using containerization and orchestration tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, or Helm for building and deploying scalable and reproducible machine learning applications.

### **System requirements:**

* Azure ML Studio, Azure DevOps, Azure Open AI (or similar AWS/GCP technologies)
* Python, Pandas
* SQL
* Power BI

### **Language requirement:**


Fluent English in speech and writing. Proficiency in at least one Scandinavian language is meritorious.

**We offer you**
----------------


We offer you a flexible hybrid workplace with a prestige-free environment where we as a team help each other to reach our goals. We encourage self-sufficient leadership for development and career opportunities. In addition to the benefits mentioned above, we offer:

* Work in a Nordic/International and flexible environment.
* Good insurance and occupational pension conditions
* Wellness allowance & access to office gym and swimming pool
* Employee benefits through PostNord's own employee foundation PostNord Plus
* Employment according to a collective agreement.

**We make everyday life easier**
--------------------------------


PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region.  

We are accountable, brave and committed, effectively leading change regardless if we lead our self or others. We emphasize teamwork, sincerity and positive relationships in the workplace. We build on our success and learn from both colleagues and mistakes. People with different backgrounds work with us. You will therefore be part of a workplace with great diversity, which contributes to better results for the business. Visit us at postnord.com

**Apply**
---------


We look forward to receiving your application! For questions about the role contact us through our recruitment platform Varbi.

  

For union representatives, visit: www.postnord.com/fackliga


We are looking forward to hear from you!  

  

#LI-Hybrid

title: Test Automation Engineer
description:
Curamet was established in 2017 by a group of specialized teams in business and Information technology; the team has extensive knowledge and expertise in IT, Telecom, Banking, Health, Retail, and many other industries.
  
In an accurate, secure, and cost-effective way, Curamet helps PaaS, SaaS, and IaaS businesses deliver their services. By providing Agile, DevOps, GitOps, and Resources as a service to our clients, we accomplish this.
  
With 6+ years of proven excellence in applying DevOps & cloud enablement, Curamet has a team of experts who can provide an effective DevOps implementation strategy. Our DevOps consulting services streamline development and operations processes to achieve a faster time to market.
  
  

**Experience:**  

* Bachelor's degree in computer sciences.
* Experience working in Software project delivery.
* 2 - 3 years of demonstrated experience in application testing (Python, Black Box / Functional, Regression, System testing, and performance testing).


**Required skills:**  

* Should have strong knowledge of test automation
* Should have strong knowledge of Python
* Should have strong Testing concepts.
* Should have the ability to understand & run a complete agile Testing life cycle.
* Should have a strong understanding of the test estimation process.
* Good knowledge of Agile Testing methodology.


**Job Summary:**  

* Our System Test Team is looking for 2-3 Senior system testers (with test automation experience) to be a part of the team to support our customers onsite, the right candidate will work to ensure good quality delivery through the identification of defects and proper documentation of the same.


**Role and Responsibilities:**  

The consultant must be able to do the following task in their job function
  
* Understanding, and implementation of the Agile Test Plan & Test methodologies.
* Prepare Test Effort Estimation and Test Data for the test cases.
* Configuring, using, and managing test suites and test data.
* Create test cases / Python
* Execute manual/automated test cases, and collect test case evidence.
* Accurately evaluate and report test results, test progress, and product quality.
* Submit defect reports on time and resolve all software issues in coordination with the development team.
* Analyze test results to assure the quality of existing and new functionalities.
* Measuring and reporting test coverage across all applicable coverage dimensions.
* Create daily status reports for test cases and defect metrics.
* Ensuring proper use of testing tools/Task management tools.

title: Agile Coach Systems
description:
**Techster Solutions** befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst **3+** års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.

  

Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.

  

**Job Description**


We are looking for a system developer and agile coach who will lead and further develop a small team within IT, focusing on the improvement and maintenance of a larger system. The role includes responsibility for both existing and new applications, and the work will be carried out both on-site in Gothenburg and remotely as agreed.

### **Main Responsibilities:**

* Lead the team towards established agile goals and ensure the development of both existing systems and new applications.
* Coordinate working methods and promote effective collaboration with both internal and external parties.
* Streamline requirements gathering and transform these into technical solutions that meet business needs.
* Develop and standardize documentation and processes to ensure consistency and quality in the work.

### **Mandatory Qualifications:**

* Experience in leading and motivating development teams to achieve project goals using agile methods.
* Familiarity with using development platforms such as .Net and tools like SQL Management Studio, as well as managing codebases through version control systems like Git/GitHub.
* Extensive knowledge and experience in programming with languages such as C#, HTML, and T-SQL.


It is advantageous if you have experience in creating consistent documentation to strengthen workflows within the team. Knowledge of JavaScript, Xunit testing, Docker, Blazor/Razor, and tools like MS DevOps or similar DevOps platforms is also beneficial.

### **Personal Qualities:**


We are looking for someone with a strong ability to translate business needs and requirements into practical technical solutions that are both efficient and feasible. The role also requires good communication skills, with the ability to present and explain technical proposals and ideas in a way that is easy to understand for both customers and partners.

**Ansökan**  

Tror du att du är **Techster Solutions** nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.

**Arbetsplats och kultur**
--------------------------


Vi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.


Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

description:
